posts.post_content:
[Sphinx Amb\*\*\*ador](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx Amb***ador), [Telepathy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Telepathy), [Levitation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Levitation), [Sleep](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sleep), [Traumatize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traumatize), [Wall of Frost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Frost), [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp), [Polymorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Polymorph), [Mind Control](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Control) ; should I go on?   
  
Back to business. Clone is a brilliant counter for legendary creatures and extremely powerful creatures. Anyone with some blue on their decks should consider having one or two. This card deserves nothing but a stunning 5/5.

posts.post_content:
[Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder), [Merfolk Looter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Merfolk Looter), [Essence Scatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Essence Scatter), [Negate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Negate), [Illusionary Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Illusionary Servant) and [Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination) are all common. Sure, there are things like [Convincing Mirage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Convincing Mirage) and [Jump](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jump) too, but there are bad cards in every colour.
  
   
As for Clone, it kills Progenitus. Progenitus should be killed. It can also copy your opponent's biggest bomb in limited, or just double the threat of your biggest creature. Solid and fun.
posts.html:
Ponder, Merfolk Looter, Essence Scatter, Negate, Illusionary Servant and Divination are all common. Sure, there are things like Convincing Mirage and Jump too, but there are bad cards in every colour.

As for Clone, it kills Progenitus. Progenitus should be killed. It can also copy your opponent's biggest bomb in limited, or just double the threat of your biggest creature. Solid and fun.

Posted By: thelittleupsman (8/5/2009 10:47:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I can't overemphasize the power of this card in limited. It is a 4-mana answer to ANY creature. Works incredibly with UB decks; I had to take out an [Enormous Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enormous Baloth)-- drop a Clone, block the Baloth, [Rise From the Grave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rise From the Grave) the Baloth and [Disentomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Disentomb) the Clone. 3 turns, and now I have board control with a pair of 7/7s that can't be [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade)d.  
  
Clone rocks.
posts.html:
I can't overemphasize the power of this card in limited. It is a 4-mana answer to ANY creature. Works incredibly with UB decks; I had to take out an Enormous Baloth-- drop a Clone, block the Baloth, Rise From the Grave the Baloth and Disentomb the Clone. 3 turns, and now I have board control with a pair of 7/7s that can't be Doom Bladed.

Clone rocks.

Posted By: TroglodyteJB (8/17/2009 9:29:53 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card has been noting but awesome for me, especially if your opponent has a pesky rare that you can't get rid of and want to pay some retribution. Really good in a green and blue deck if you can play out [Mirror Gallery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Gallery) and then [Momir Vig](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Momir Vig). If you have the opportunity to clone Momir and start playing cheap creatures that are both green and blue, you're suddenly cycling two creature into your hand for every one creature you play! Its intimidating to your opponents. Throw down a [Natures Will](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Natures Will) and you start the chaos all over again. :D I definitely love this card.
posts.html:
